<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	PART I
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Glossary of Units of Measurements and Industry Terms
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Units of measurements and industry terms are defined in the Glossary of Units of Measurements and Industry Terms, included at the end of this report.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Cautionary Statement Concerning Forward-Looking Statements
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	This report contains &#8220;forward-looking statements&#8221; within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. These statements are subject to risks and uncertainties and are based on the beliefs and assumptions of management and information currently available to management. The use of words such as &#8220;believes,&#8221; &#8220;expects,&#8221; &#8220;anticipates,&#8221; &#8220;intends,&#8221; &#8220;plans,&#8221; &#8220;estimates,&#8221; &#8220;should,&#8221; &#8220;likely,&#8221; or similar expressions indicate forward-looking statements. Forward-looking statements included in this report include statements relating to future capital expenditures and projects, the adequacy and nature of future sources of financing, possible future impairment charges, midstream capacity issues, future differentials, and future production relative to volume commitments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The identification in this report of factors that may affect our future performance and the accuracy of forward-looking statements is meant to be illustrative and by no means exhaustive. All forward-looking statements should be evaluated with the understanding of their inherent uncertainty.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:120PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:72PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the availability of water for use in our operations; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:120PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:72PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the risks and uncertainties described and referenced in "Risk Factors."
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note Regarding Change in Fiscal Year
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In February 2016, the Company changed its fiscal year-end to December 31 from August 31. Certain information in this report is presented as of and for the fiscal years ended August 31, 2015, 2014, 2013 and 2012.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1

<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A10-KSYRG20161231_HTM_S9AB84C22A1F05D0CAF22E3FEF693886D">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<BR>
</DIV>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:96PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ITEM 1.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	BUSINESS
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A10-KSYRG20161231_HTM_S940A7589321A5FF49DB493A28D3EAC2F">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Overview
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Synergy Resources Corporation ("we," "us," "Synergy," or the "Company") is a growth-oriented independent oil and gas company engaged in the acquisition, development, and production of oil and natural gas in the Denver-Julesburg Basin (&#8220;D-J Basin&#8221;), which we believe to be one of the premier, liquids-rich oil and natural gas resource plays in the United States. The D-J Basin generally extends from the Denver metropolitan area throughout northeast Colorado into Wyoming, Nebraska, and Kansas. It contains hydrocarbon-bearing deposits in several formations, including the Niobrara, Codell, Greenhorn, Shannon, Sussex, J-Sand, and D-Sand. The area has produced oil and natural gas for over fifty years and benefits from established infrastructure including midstream and refining capacity, long reserve life, and multiple service providers.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our drilling and completion activities are focused in the Wattenberg Field, predominantly in Weld County, Colorado, an area that covers the western flank of the D-J Basin. Currently, we are focused on the horizontal development of the Codell and Niobrara formations, which are characterized by relatively high liquids content.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In order to maintain operational focus while preserving developmental flexibility, we strive to attain operational control of a majority of the wells in which we have a working interest. We currently operate approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	73%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of our proved producing reserves, and anticipate operating substantially all of our future net drilling locations. Our current development plan anticipates that all of our future activities will be concentrated in the Wattenberg Field.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	During the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	twelve months ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we continued to execute our plans for growth through development of our existing oil and gas properties and strategic acquisitions of leasehold and producing properties. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we are the operator of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	324
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;gross (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	288
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;net) producing wells, of which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	110
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;gross (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	106
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;net) are Codell or Niobrara horizontal wells. The Company has also participated as a non-operator in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	307
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;gross (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	65
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;net) producing wells. In addition, there were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	49
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;gross (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	44
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;net) operated wells in various stages of drilling or completion as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which excludes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;gross (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;net) wells for which we have only set surface casings.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	For the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	twelve months ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, our average net daily production was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	11,670
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;BOED and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	9,548
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;BOED, respectively. By comparison, during the years ended August 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, our average production rate was 8,750 BOED, 4,290 BOED, and 2,117 BOED, respectively. By the end of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, over
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	96%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of our daily operated production was from horizontal wells.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A10-KSYRG20161231_HTM_SDC8BDB7478975B0DA453FF476AC5AF9C">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Strategy
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our primary objective is to enhance shareholder value by increasing our net asset value, net reserves, and cash flow through development, exploitation, exploration, and acquisitions of oil and gas properties. We intend to follow a balanced risk strategy by allocating capital expenditures to lower risk development and exploitation activities. Key elements of our business strategy include the following:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Concentrate on our existing core area in the D-J Basin, where we have significant operating experience.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	All of our current wells and our proved undeveloped acreage is located either in or adjacent to the Wattenberg Field.&#160;&#160;Focusing our operations in this area leverages our management, technical, and operational experience in the basin.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Develop and exploit existing oil and gas properties.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;Our principal growth strategy has been to develop and exploit our properties to add reserves.&#160;&#160;In the Wattenberg Field, we target three benches of the Niobrara formation as well as the Codell formation for horizontal drilling and production. We believe horizontal drilling is the most efficient way to recover the potential hydrocarbons and consider the Wattenberg Field to be relatively low-risk because information gained from the large number of existing wells can be applied to potential future wells.&#160;&#160;There is enough similarity between wells in the Wattenberg Field that the exploitation process is generally repeatable.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;PADDING-LEFT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Improve hydrocarbon recovery through increased well density.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;We utilize what we believe to be industry best practices in our effort to determine the optimal recovery area for each well. Early horizontal well development in the Wattenberg Field generally assumed optimal recoveries would be obtained utilizing between 12 and 16 wells per 640-acre section. As horizontal well development has matured, well density assumptions have generally increased beyond 16 wells per section depending on the specific area of the field being drilled.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Complete selective acquisitions.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;We seek to acquire developed and undeveloped oil and gas properties, primarily in the Wattenberg Field.&#160;&#160;We generally seek acquisitions that will provide us with opportunities for reserve additions and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:48PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	increased cash flow through production enhancement and additional development and exploratory prospect generation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Retain control over the operation of a substantial portion of our production.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As operator of a majority of our wells and undeveloped acreage, we control the timing and selection of new wells to be drilled.&#160;&#160;This allows us to modify our capital spending as our financial resources and underlying lease terms allow and market conditions permit.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;PADDING-LEFT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Maintain financial flexibility while focusing on operational cost control.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We strive to be a cost-efficient operator and to maintain a relatively low utilization of debt, which enhances our financial flexibility. Our high degree of operational control, as well as our focus on operating efficiencies and short return on investment cycle times, is central to our operating strategy.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;PADDING-LEFT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Use the latest technology to maximize returns.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;Our development objective for individual well optimization is to drill and complete wells with lateral lengths of 7,000' to 10,000' as opposed to the 4,000' laterals that were initially drilled in the Wattenberg Field. Utilizing petrophysical and seismic data, a 3-D model is developed for each leasehold section to assist in determining optimal wellbore placement, well spacing, and stimulation design. This process is augmented with formation-specific drilling and completion execution designs and coupled with localized production results to provide a continuous improvement philosophy in optimizing the value per acre of our leasehold throughout our development program.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;PADDING-LEFT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A10-KSYRG20161231_HTM_S33EAB5FF11085018B635FA232CC1BB7F">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;PADDING-LEFT:72PX;TEXT-INDENT:-72PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Competitive Strengths
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We believe that we are positioned to successfully execute our business strategy because of the following competitive strengths:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Core acreage position in the Wattenberg Field.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Wells in our core properties in the Wattenberg Field generally exhibit high liquids content, and those properties are generally prospective for Niobrara A, B, and C bench and Codell development. We believe that these factors will lead to attractive EURs per acres of leasehold, per unit capital and operating costs, and rates of return. Increased well density within the Codell and Niobrara formations, as well as our acquisition efforts and organic leasing efforts within the core Wattenberg Field, have added to our multi-year drilling inventory.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Financial flexibility.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our capital structure, along with our high degree of operational control, continues to provide us with significant financial flexibility. We have historically utilized very little debt in our capital structure. Our low debt level has enabled us to make capital decisions with limited restrictions imposed by debt covenants, lender oversight, and/or mandatory repayment schedules. Additionally, as the operator of substantially all of our anticipated future drilling locations per our December 31, 2016 reserve report, we control the timing and selection of drilling locations as well as completion schedules. This allows us to modify our capital spending program depending on financial resources, leasehold requirements, and market conditions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;PADDING-LEFT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We currently operate over
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	73%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of our proved producing reserves, and over
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	98%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of our drilling and completion expenditures during the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	twelve months ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;were focused on the Wattenberg Field. Substantially all of our drilling and completion expenditures for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;calendar year are anticipated to be focused on the Wattenberg Field. A high degree of operational and capital control gives us both operational focus and development flexibility to maximize returns on our leasehold position.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A10-KSYRG20161231_HTM_S140F010CA6FC5A6980CBEA2223CD19F8">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Significant Business Developments
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Acquisitions
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In May 2016, the Company entered into an agreement ("GC Agreement") to purchase a total of approximately 72,000 gross (33,100 net) acres located in an area known as the Greeley-Crescent development area in Weld County Colorado, primarily in and around the city of Greeley, for $505 million ("GC Acquisition"). Estimated net daily production from the acquired properties was approximately 2,400 BOE at the time we entered into the agreement. On
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;">
	June 14, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Company closed on the portion of the assets comprised of the undeveloped lands and non-operated production. The effective date of this part of the transaction was April 1, 2016, and the purchase price was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$486.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, comprised of&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$485.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;in cash and the assumption of certain liabilities. The second closing will cover the operated producing properties and is expected to be completed in 2017. The Company has placed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$18.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in escrow to be released upon the second closing. For the second closing, the effective date will be April 1, 2016 for the horizontal wells to be acquired and the first day of the calendar month in which the closing for such properties occurs for the vertical wells. The second closing is subject to certain closing conditions including the receipt of regulatory approval. Accordingly, the second closing of the transaction may not close in the expected time frame or at all.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	During 2016, the Company completed various other acquisitions of undeveloped oil and natural gas leasehold interests in the D-J Basin for a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$20.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in cash and the assumption of certain liabilities or receivables. These acquisitions were completed in an effort to increase our working interests and to extend the lateral lengths of our wells. See Note
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to the consolidated financial statements included in this report for further discussion.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Divestitures
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In April 2016, the Company agreed to divest approximately 3,700 net undeveloped acres primarily in Adams County, Colorado and 107 vertical wells primarily in Weld County, Colorado for total consideration of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$24.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in cash and the assumption by the buyers of $0.5 million in liabilities. The divested assets had associated production of approximately 200 BOED at the time of sale. The vertical well transaction closed in April 2016 and the undeveloped acreage transaction closed in June 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In January 2017, we executed a purchase and sale agreement with a private party resulting in the divestiture of acreage outside of the Company's core development area. The transaction resulted in the Company divesting approximately 10,000 net undeveloped acres and approximately 700 BOED of associated production for $71 million. The transaction is expected to close in the first quarter of 2017.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Equity offerings
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In January 2016, the Company closed on the sale of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	16,100,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of common stock pursuant to an underwriting agreement with Credit Suisse Securities (USA) LLC, acting severally on behalf of itself and the other underwriters.&#160;&#160;The price to the Company was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.545
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share, and net proceeds to the Company, after deduction of underwriting discounts and expenses payable by the Company, were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$89.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Proceeds were used to repay amounts borrowed under the revolving credit facility and for general corporate purposes, which included continuing to develop our acreage position in the Wattenberg Field and funding a portion of our 2016 capital expenditure program.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In April 2016, the Company closed on the sale of an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	22,425,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of common stock pursuant to an underwriting agreement with substantially the same underwriting group.&#160;&#160;The price to the Company was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$7.3535
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share, and net proceeds to the Company, after deduction of underwriting discounts and expenses payable by the Company, were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$164.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.&#160;&#160;The proceeds of this offering were used for general corporate purposes, including to fund the GC Acquisition.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>

	51,750,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>

	$5.597
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share, and
</FONT>
</DIV>

<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4

<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	net proceeds to the Company, after deduction of underwriting discounts and expenses payable by the Company, were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$289.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The proceeds of this offering were used for general corporate purposes, including to fund the GC Acquisition.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Revolving Credit Facility
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We continue to maintain a borrowing arrangement with our bank syndicate to provide us with liquidity, which could be used to develop oil and gas properties, acquire new oil and gas properties, and for working capital and other general corporate purposes. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, this revolving credit facility (sometimes referred to as the "Revolver") provides for maximum borrowings of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$500 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, subject to adjustments based upon a borrowing base calculation, which is redetermined semi-annually using updated reserve reports. The Revolver is collateralized by certain of our assets, including substantially all of our producing wells and developed oil and gas leases, and bears a variable interest rate on borrowings with the effective rate varying with utilization. The Revolver expires on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;15, 2019
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. See further discussion in Note
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to our consolidated financial statements
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In October 2016, the Revolver was amended in connection with the semi-annual redetermination of the borrowing base. The borrowing base was increased from $145 million to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$160 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Due to outstanding letters of credit, approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$159.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the borrowing base was available to use for future borrowings as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Revolver contains covenants that, among other things, restrict the payment of dividends and limit our overall commodity derivative position to a maximum position that varies over 5 years as a percentage of estimated proved reserves as projected in the semi-annual reserve report.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Revolver also requires the Company to maintain compliance with certain financial and liquidity ratio covenants. Under the requirements, the Company, on a quarterly basis, must not (a) at any time permit its ratio of total funded debt as of such time to EBITDAX, as defined in the agreement, to be greater than or equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to 1.0; or (b) as of the last day o
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	f any fiscal quarter permit its current ratio, as defined in the agreement, to be less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	1.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	to 1.0. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	, the most recent compliance date, the C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	ompany was in compliance with these covenants and expects to remain in compliance throughout the next 12-month period.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Senior Notes
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In June 2016, the Company issued&#160;$80&#160;million aggregate principal amount of&#160;9%&#160;Senior Notes ("Senior Notes") in a private placement to qualified institutional buyers. The maturity for the payment of principal is June 13, 2021. Interest on the&#160;Senior Notes accrues at 9% and began accruing on June 14, 2016. Interest is payable on June 15 and December 15 of each year, beginning on December 15, 2016. The&#160;Senior Notes were issued pursuant to an indenture dated as of June&#160;14, 2016 (the "Indenture") and are guaranteed on a senior unsecured basis by the Company&#8217;s existing and future subsidiaries that incur or guarantee certain indebtedness, including indebtedness under the Revolver. The net proceeds from the sale of the Senior Notes were&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$75.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;after deductions of&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$4.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for expenses and underwriting discounts and commissions. The net proceeds were used to fund the GC Acquisition. The Indenture contains covenants that restrict the Company&#8217;s ability and the ability of certain of its subsidiaries to, among other restrictions and limitations: (i)&#160;incur additional indebtedness; (ii)&#160;incur liens; (iii)&#160;pay dividends; (iv)&#160;consolidate, merge, or transfer all or substantially all of its or their assets; (v)&#160;engage in transactions with affiliates; or (vi)&#160;engage in certain restricted business activities.&#160; These covenants are subject to a number of exceptions and qualifications.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_4"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Drilling and Completion Operations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	During the periods presented below, we drilled or participated in the drilling of a number of wells that reached productive status in each respective period.&#160; During the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	twelve months ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we completed 24 wells in two separate spacing units. &#160;Due to proved well density thresholds,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the wells are classified as exploratory and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	18
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the wells are classified as development.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8212;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;">

</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	* Excludes 3 gross (0.42 net) productive wells which we participated in on a non-operated basis.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	All of the oil wells in the table above are located in, or adjacent to, the Wattenberg Field of the D-J Basin. The three natural gas wells in the table above are located in Yuma County, Colorado. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we were the operator of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	49
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;gross (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	44
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;net) wells in progress, which excludes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;gross (

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	9

	&#32;net) wells for which we have only set surface casings, that were not included in the above well counts.

<A NAME="eolPage10"></A>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A10-KSYRG20161231_HTM_S656EC88D9C4258729A0AC0238418F46C">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Major Customers
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Historically, we sold our oil production to local refineries and, to a lesser degree, third-party marketers. During 2014, we secured contracts with additional oil purchasers who transport oil via pipelines. Under the contracts, we have delivery commitments covering a portion of our anticipated future production over the next four to five years. Our natural gas is sold under contracts with two midstream gas gathering and processing companies. We believe that both gas processing and oil takeaway capacity are sufficient to meet our anticipated production growth. See further discussion in Note
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	16
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A10-KSYRG20161231_HTM_S5F6F397002E4509DBBCE84CFF5B38653">
</A>
</DIV>

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_6"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Oil and Gas Properties, Wells, Operations, and Acreage
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We believe that the title to our oil and gas properties is good and defensible in accordance with standards generally accepted in the oil and gas industry, subject to such exceptions which, in our opinion, are not so material as to detract substantially from the use or value of such properties. Our properties are typically subject, in one degree or another, to one or more of the following:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	royalties and other burdens and obligations, expressed or implied, under oil and gas leases;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	pooling, unitization and communitization agreements, declarations, and orders; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:0PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:72PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:48PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	easements, restrictions, rights-of-way, and other matters that commonly affect property.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	To the extent that such burdens and obligations affect our rights to production revenues, they have been taken into account in calculating our net revenue interests and in estimating the size and value of our reserves. We believe that the burdens and obligations affecting our properties are customary in the industry for properties of the kind that we own.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

	The following table shows, as of

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:7PT">
	1
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Undeveloped acreage includes leasehold interests on which wells have not been drilled or completed to the point that would permit the production of commercial quantities of oil and natural gas regardless of whether the leasehold interest is classified as containing proved undeveloped reserves.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;The following table shows, as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the status of our gross acreage:
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Leases that are held by production generally remain in force so long as oil or natural gas is produced from the well on
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	7
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage11"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the particular lease.&#160;&#160;Leased acres which are not held by production may require annual rental payments to maintain the lease until the expiration of the lease or the time oil or natural gas is produced from one or more wells drilled on the leased acreage.&#160;&#160;At the time oil or natural gas is produced from wells drilled on the leased acreage, the lease is generally considered to be held by production.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The following table shows the calendar years during which our leases not currently held by production will expire unless a productive oil or natural gas well is drilled on the lease or the lease is renewed.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	45,300
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

	2020
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	147,900
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

	After 2020

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The overriding royalty interests that we own are not material to our business.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A10-KSYRG20161231_HTM_S60D1A40AD09C597B851FEE857785E7B4">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Oil and Natural Gas Reserves
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our estimated proved reserve quantities
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	41%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.&#160;&#160;At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we had estimated proved reserves of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	38.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;million barrels of oil and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	331.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;billion cubic feet of gas. The estimated standardized measure of future net cash flow from our reserves at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	$434.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and the
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	estimated PV-10 value of our reserves at that date was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$476.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. PV-10 is a non-GAAP measure that reflects the present value, discounted at 10%, of estimated future net revenues from our proved reserves. We present a reconciliation of PV-10 value to the standardized measure of discounted future net cash flows in Item 7 under "Non-GAAP Financial Measures." The PV-10 value as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;increased compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$38.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The increase in estimated proved reserve quantities and PV-10 value is primarily due to better drilling efficiencies leading to an increase in the number of wells drilled per year and the GC Acquisition, which created spacing units with higher interests and the opportunity to drill longer laterals.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Ryder Scott prepared the estimates of our proved reserves, future production, and income attributable to our leasehold interests as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.&#160;&#160;Ryder Scott is an independent petroleum engineering firm that has been providing petroleum consulting services worldwide for over seventy years.&#160;&#160;The estimates of proved reserves, future production, and income attributable to certain leasehold and royalty interests are based on technical analyses conducted by teams of geoscientists and engineers employed at Ryder Scott.&#160;&#160;The office of Ryder Scott that prepared our reserves estimates is registered in the State of Texas (License #F-1580).&#160;&#160;Ryder Scott prepared our reserve estimate based upon a review of property interests being appraised, historical production, lease operating expenses, price differentials, authorizations for expenditure, and geological and geophysical data.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The report of Ryder Scott dated January 20, 2017, which contains further discussions of the reserve estimates and evaluations prepared by Ryder Scott, as well as the qualifications of Ryder Scott&#8217;s technical personnel responsible for overseeing such estimates and evaluations, is attached as Exhibit 99.1 to this Annual Report on Form 10-K.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	Our reserves technical team, which consists of our Reservoir Engineering Manager, VP of Exploration, COO - Operations, and COO - Development, oversaw the preparation of the reserve estimates by Ryder Scott to ensure accuracy and completeness of the data prior to and after submission.&#160;&#160;Our technical team has an average of over thirty years of experience in oil and gas exploration and development.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our proved reserves include only those amounts which we reasonably expect to recover in the future from known oil and natural gas reservoirs under existing economic and operating conditions, at current prices and costs, under existing regulatory practices, and with existing technology.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, any changes in prices, operating and development costs, regulations, technology, or other factors could significantly increase or decrease estimates of proved reserves.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Estimates of volumes of proved reserves at year end are presented in barrels for oil and Mcf for natural gas at the official temperature and pressure bases of the areas in which the natural gas reserves are located.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The proved reserves attributable to producing wells and/or reservoirs were estimated by performance methods.&#160;&#160;These performance methods include decline curve analysis, which incorporate extrapolations of historical production and pressure data
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	8
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage12"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	available through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in those cases where this data was considered to be definitive.&#160;&#160;The data used in this analysis was obtained from public sources and was considered sufficient for calculating producing reserves. The undeveloped reserves were estimated by the analogy method.&#160;&#160;The analogy method uses pertinent well data obtained from public sources that was available through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;

	Below are estimates of our net proved reserves at

	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, all of which are located in Colorado:

	62,570

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The prices for the oil and natural gas reserves as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;are based on the twelve-month arithmetic average for the first of month prices from January 1,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The following table presents the prices used to prepare the reserve estimates, based upon the unweighted arithmetic average of the first day of the month price for each month within the twelve-month period prior to the end of the respective reporting period presented as adjusted for our differentials:
</FONT>
</DIV>
