<EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Results of Operations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Material changes of certain items in our consolidated statements of operations included in our consolidated financial statements for the periods presented are discussed below. All references to the year ended December 31, 2015 are unaudited.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	For the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	year ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;compared to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	For the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we reported net
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	loss
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$219.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;compared to net
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	loss
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$131.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;during the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Net
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	loss
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per basic and diluted share was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$(1.26)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;compared to net
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	loss
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share per basic and diluted share of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$(1.27)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Revenues increased slightly during the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;compared to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	631
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;gross producing wells, compared to 609 gross producing wells as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The impact of changing prices on our commodity derivative positions also drove significant differences in our results of operations between the two periods.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Net oil and natural gas production for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;averaged
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	11,670
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;BOED, an increase of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	22%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;over average production of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	9,548
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;BOED in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. From
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, our well count increased by 25 net horizontal wells, growing our reserves and daily production totals. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	18%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;decline in average sales prices offset the effects of increased production, resulting in relatively flat revenues overall.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	LOE

</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Lease operating and workover costs tend to increase or decrease primarily in relation to the number and type of wells in production
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	and, to a lesser extent, on fluctuation in oil field service costs and changes in the production mix of oil and natural gas. During the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	, we experienced increased production expense primarily due to operating additional horizontal wells, increased production, and an increase in regulatory compliance projects.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Production taxes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	- Taxes tend to increase or decrease primarily based on the value of oil and natural gas sold. During the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, production taxes were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.34
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per BOE, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$9.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.70
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per BOE, during the prior year comparable period. As a percent of revenues, taxes were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5.3%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	8.9%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. The decrease in 2016 is due to a change in estimate for production taxes based on recent historical experience and additional information received during the period. Based on this analysis, our production tax accrual was reduced, resulting in an approximate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;reduction to our production taxes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	46
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	DD&amp;A
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- The following table summarizes the components of DD&amp;A:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_25"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">

	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Years Ended December 31,
</FONT>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(in thousands)
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	For the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, depletion of oil and gas properties was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$10.93
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per BOE compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$17.81
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per BOE for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The decrease in the DD&amp;A rate was the result of a decrease in the ratio of total costs capitalized in the full cost pool to the estimated recoverable reserves. This ratio was significantly reduced due to the impairments of our full cost pool, which primarily occurred during the second half of calendar 2015 and the first half of 2016, and the increase in our total proved reserves. Capitalized costs of proved oil and gas properties are depleted quarterly using the units-of-production method based on estimated reserves, wherein the ratio of production volumes for the quarter to beginning of quarter estimated total reserves determines the depletion rate.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Full cost ceiling impairment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- During the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we recognized an impairment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$215.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as compared to an impairment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$141.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, representing the amount by which the net capitalized costs of our oil and gas properties exceeded our full cost ceiling. See &#8220;-Critical Accounting Policies-Oil and Gas Properties, including Ceiling Test.&#8221;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	General and Administrative (&#8220;G&amp;A&#8221;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	8.95
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	G&amp;A includes all overhead costs associated with employee compensation and benefits, insurance, facilities, professional fees, and regulatory costs, among others. During the&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we increased our employee count from 62 as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	96
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, while reducing the number of consultants, advisors, and contractors that had historically been used for certain tasks. Additionally, during the year ended December 31, 2015, we awarded bonuses, consisting of cash and restricted stock, to management, employees, and directors. Most significantly, bonuses totaling approximately $4.8 million (including restricted stock valued at $4.0 million) were paid to our former co-CEOs, both of whom resigned as of December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our G&amp;A expense for the&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;includes stock-based compensation of&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$9.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;compared to&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$14.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;for the&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Stock-based compensation is a non-cash charge that is based on the calculated fair value of stock options, performance stock units, restricted share units, and stock bonus shares that we grant for compensatory purposes. For stock options, the fair value is estimated using the Black-Scholes-Merton option pricing model. For performance stock units, the fair value is estimated using the Monte Carlo model. For restricted stock units and stock bonus shares, the fair value is estimated using the closing stock price on the grant date. Amounts are pro-rated over the vesting terms of the award agreements, which are generally three to five years.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	47
</FONT>

<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage51"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Pursuant to the requirements under the full cost accounting method for oil and gas properties, we identify all general and administrative costs that relate directly to the acquisition of undeveloped mineral leases and the exploration and development of properties. Those costs are reclassified from G&amp;A expenses and capitalized into the full cost pool. The increase in capitalized costs from the&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;reflects our increased headcount of individuals performing activities to maintain and acquire leases and develop our properties.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Commodity derivative gains (losses)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- As more fully described in &#8220;-Liquidity and Capital Resources-Oil and Gas Commodity Contracts,&#8221; we use commodity contracts to help mitigate the risks inherent in the price volatility of oil and natural gas. For the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we realized a cash settlement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	gain
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, net of previously incurred premiums attributable to the settled commodity contracts. In 2015, we realized a cash settlement
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	gain
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$28.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In addition, for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we recorded an unrealized
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	loss
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$10.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to recognize the mark-to-market change in fair value of our commodity contracts. In comparison, in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we reported an unrealized
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	loss
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$17.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Unrealized
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	losses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;are non-cash items.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income taxes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- We reported income tax
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	expense
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, calculated at an effective tax rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. In 2015, we reported income tax
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	benefit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$14.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, calculated at an effective tax rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	10%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. As explained in more detail below, during the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	year ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the effective tax rate was substantially reduced by the recognition of a full valuation allowance on the net deferred tax asset.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In assessing the realizability of deferred tax assets, management considers whether it is more likely than not that some portion or all of the deferred tax assets will be realized. Based on the level of losses in the current period and the level of uncertainty with respect to future taxable income over the period in which the deferred tax assets are deductible, a&#160;valuation allowance&#160;has been provided as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. During 2015, we reached the same conclusion; therefore, a&#160;valuation allowance&#160;has been provided as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	For the year ended August 31, 2015, compared to the year ended August 31, 2014
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	For the year ended August&#160;31, 2015, we reported net income of $18.0 million compared to net income of $28.9 million during the year ended August&#160;31, 2014. Net income per basic and diluted share were $0.19 and $0.19, respectively, for the year ended August 31, 2015 compared to earnings per share of $0.38 and $0.37 per basic and diluted share, respectively, for the year ended August 31, 2014. Revenues increased $20.6 million during the year ended August&#160;31, 2015 compared to the year ended August&#160;31, 2014 due to rapid growth in production as discussed below. As of August&#160;31, 2015, we had 582 gross producing wells, compared to 404 gross producing wells as of August&#160;31, 2014. However, although our production more than doubled during the comparable periods, our revenues during the year ended August&#160;31, 2015 increased only 20% as a result of declining oil and natural gas prices. The impact of changing prices on our commodity derivative positions also drove significant differences in our results of operations between the two periods.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	48

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Oil and Natural Gas Production and Revenues
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- For the year ended August&#160;31, 2015, we recorded total oil and natural gas revenues of $124.8 million compared to $104.2 million for the year ended August&#160;31, 2014, an increase of $20.6 million or 20%. The following table summarizes key production and revenue statistics:

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Net oil and natural gas production for the year ended August&#160;31, 2015 averaged 8,750 BOED, an increase of 104% over average production of 4,290 BOED in the year ended August&#160;31, 2014. Year over year, we added 48 net horizontal wells, including 3 net horizontal wells acquired, increasing our reserves, producing wells, and daily production totals. The decline in average sales prices by approximately 41% mostly offset the effects of increased production, resulting in an overall 20% increase of revenues.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	LOE
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- Direct operating costs of producing oil and natural gas are reported as follows (in thousands):
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Lease operating and workover costs tend to increase or decrease primarily in relation to the number of wells in production and, to a lesser extent, on fluctuation in oil field service costs and changes in the production mix of oil and natural gas. During the year ended August 31, 2015, we experienced decreased production costs per BOE primarily as a result of increased production. Partially offsetting this decline in costs was increased costs resulting from intermittent midstream restrictions that reduced the efficiency and capacity of the gas gathering system.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Production taxes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	- During the year ended August&#160;31, 2015, production taxes were $11.3 million, or $3.55 per BOE, compared to $9.7 million, or $6.17 per BOE, during the prior year. Taxes tend to increase or decrease primarily based on the value of oil and natural gas sold. As a percent of revenues, taxes were 9.1% and 9.3% for the years ended August&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	For the year ended August&#160;31, 2015, depletion of oil and gas properties was $20.62 per BOE compared to $21.05 per BOE for the year ended August&#160;31, 2014. The decrease in the DD&amp;A rate was the result of a decrease in the ratio of total costs capitalized in the full cost pool to the estimated recoverable reserves. Capitalized costs of proved oil and gas properties are depleted quarterly using the units-of-production method based on estimated reserves, wherein the ratio of production volumes for the quarter to beginning-of-quarter estimated total reserves determine the depletion rate. Since DD&amp;A expense represents depletion of historical costs, our implemented reductions in well costs were not fully reflected in the rate.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Full cost ceiling impairment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- During the year ended August&#160;31, 2015, we recognized a total impairment of $16.0 million, representing the amount by which the net capitalized costs of our oil and gas properties exceeded our full cost ceiling. See &#8220;-Critical Accounting Policies-Oil and Gas Properties, including Ceiling Test.&#8221;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	G&amp;A includes all overhead costs associated with employee compensation and benefits, insurance, facilities, professional fees, and regulatory costs, among others. In an effort to minimize overhead costs, we employed a total staff of 36 employees as of August 31, 2015 and used consultants, advisors, and contractors to perform certain tasks when we considered it to be cost effective.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Although G&amp;A costs increased as we grew the business, we strove to maintain an efficient overhead structure.&#160;&#160;For the year ended August&#160;31, 2015, G&amp;A was $5.95 per BOE compared to $6.48&#160;per BOE for the year ended August&#160;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our G&amp;A expense for the year ended August&#160;31, 2015 includes stock-based compensation of $7.7 million compared to $3.0 million for the year ended August&#160;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Pursuant to the requirements under the full cost accounting method for oil and gas properties, we identify all general and administrative costs that relate directly to the acquisition of undeveloped mineral leases and the development of properties. Those costs were reclassified from G&amp;A expenses and capitalized into the full cost pool. The increase in capitalized costs from 2014 to 2015 reflected our increasing activities to acquire leases and develop the properties.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Commodity derivative gains (losses)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- As more fully described in &#8220;-Liquidity and Capital Resources-Oil and Gas Commodity Contracts,&#8221; we use commodity contracts to help mitigate the risks inherent in the price volatility of oil and natural gas. For the year ended August&#160;31, 2015, we realized a cash settlement gain of $30.5 million, including gains of $10.0 million from the settlement of contracts at their scheduled maturity dates and gains of $20.5 million from the early liquidation of &#8220;in-the-money&#8221; contracts. For the prior year, we realized a cash settlement loss of $2.1 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In addition, for the year ended August&#160;31, 2015, we recorded an unrealized gain of $1.8 million to recognize the mark-to-market change in fair value of our commodity contracts. In comparison, in the year ended August&#160;31, 2014, we reported an unrealized gain of $2.5 million. Unrealized gains are non-cash items.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	50
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage54"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income taxes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;- We reported income tax expense of $11.7 million for the year ended August&#160;31, 2015, calculated at an effective tax rate of 39%. During the comparable prior year period, we reported income tax expense of $15.0 million, calculated at an effective tax rate of 34%. For both periods, it appeared that the tax liability would be substantially deferred into future years. During both periods, the effective tax rate differed from the federal and state statutory rate primarily due to the impact of deductions for percentage depletion.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Each year, management evaluates all the positive and negative evidence regarding our tax position and reaches a conclusion on the most likely outcome.&#160;&#160;As of August 31, 2015 and 2014, we concluded that it was more likely than not that we would be able to realize a benefit from the net operating loss carryforward and, therefore, included it in our inventory of deferred tax assets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>

<DIV>
<A NAME="A10-KSYRG20161231_HTM_S740A49B69F36516B9EE44381E8BF2553">
</A>
</DIV>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Historically, our primary sources of capital have been net cash provided by the sale of equity and debt securities, cash flow from operations, proceeds from the sale of properties, and borrowings under bank credit facilities.&#160; Our primary use of capital has been for the exploration, development, and acquisition of oil and gas properties.&#160;&#160;Our future success in growing proved reserves and production will be highly dependent on the capital resources available to us.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We believe that our capital resources, including cash on hand, the previously announced sale of non-core assets totaling $71 million (subject to certain closing conditions), amounts available under our revolving credit facility, and cash flow from operating activities will be sufficient to fund our planned capital expenditures and operating expenses for the next twelve months. We funded the purchase price of the GC Acquisition through a combination of cash on hand and proceeds of financing transactions, including the issuance of the Senior Notes. To the extent actual operating results differ from our anticipated results, available borrowings under our credit facility are reduced, or we experience other unfavorable events, our liquidity could be adversely impacted.&#160;&#160;Our liquidity would also be affected if we increase our capital expenditures or complete one or more additional acquisitions. Terms of future financings may be unfavorable, and we cannot assure investors that funding will be available on acceptable terms.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As operator of the majority of our wells and undeveloped acreage, we control the timing and selection of new wells to be drilled. This allows us to modify our capital spending as our financial resources allow and market conditions support. Additionally, our relatively low utilization of debt enhances our financial flexibility as it provides a potential source of future liquidity while currently not overly burdening us with restrictive financial covenants and mandatory repayment schedules.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Sources and Uses
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our sources and uses of capital are heavily influenced by the prices that we receive for our production. During the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	twelve months ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the NYMEX-WTI&#160;oil price&#160;ranged from a low of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$26.19
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per Bbl on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	February&#160;11, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to a high of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$54.01
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per Bbl on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;28, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, while the NYMEX-Henry Hub natural gas price ranged from a low of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.64
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per MMBtu on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	March&#160;3, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to a high of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.93
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per MMBtu on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;28, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. These markets will likely continue to be volatile in the future. To deal with the volatility in commodity prices, we maintain a flexible capital investment program and seek to maintain a high operating interest in our leaseholds with limited long-term capital commitments. This enables us to accelerate or decelerate our activities quickly in response to changing industry environments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	51
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage55"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we had cash and cash equivalents of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$18.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, $80 million outstanding on our Senior Notes, and no balance outstanding under our revolving credit facility. Our sources and (uses) of funds for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	twelve months ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and the twelve months ended August&#160;31, 2015 and 2014 are summarized below (in thousands):
</FONT>
</DIV>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Net cash provided by operating activities was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$48.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$103.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	twelve months ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively, and $125.1 million and $74.9 million for the years ended August&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The decline in cash from operating activities over the periods reflects the decline in commodity prices, partially offset by the increase in production.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	&#32;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we received cash proceeds from the following financing activities which were used to repay amounts borrowed under the Revolver, for general corporate purposes (which included continuing to develop our acreage position in the Wattenberg Field) and paying for the purchase price for the GC Acquisition:
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Credit Facility
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We maintain a borrowing arrangement with a banking syndicate with a maturity date of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;15, 2019
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.&#160; The arrangement, in the form of a revolving credit facility, was most recently amended with the Ninth Amendment to the credit facility in October&#160;2016.&#160; The arrangement provides for a maximum loan commitment of $500 million; however, the maximum amount that we can borrow at any one time is subject to a borrowing base limitation, which stipulates that we may borrow up to the lesser of the maximum loan commitment or the borrowing base.&#160; The borrowing base can increase or decrease based upon the value of the collateral, which secures any amounts borrowed under the line of credit.&#160; The value of the collateral will generally be derived with reference to the estimated future net cash flows from our proved oil and natural gas reserves, discounted by 10%. Amounts borrowed under the facility are secured by certain of our assets, including substantially all of our producing wells and developed oil and gas leases
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	52
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage56"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The borrowing base was increased to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$160 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;on October 14, 2016. As of December&#160;31, 2016, there was no outstanding principal balance,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in letters of credit was applied against the Revolver, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$159.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was available to us for future borrowings. The next semi-annual redetermination of the borrowing base has been scheduled for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	May 2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Interest on our revolving line of credit accrues at a variable rate. The interest rate pricing grid contains a graduated escalation in applicable margin for increased utilization.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Revolver requires the Company to maintain compliance with certain financial and liquidity ratio covenants. Under the requirements, the Company, on a quarterly basis, must not (a) at any time permit its ratio of total funded debt as of such time to EBITDAX, as defined in the agreement, to be greater than or equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to 1.0; or (b) as of the last day o
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	f any fiscal quarter permit its current ratio, as defined in the agreement, to be less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	1.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	to 1.0.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	&#32;&#32;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Senior Notes
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In June 2016, the Company issued&#160;$80&#160;million aggregate principal amount of the&#160;Senior Notes in a private placement to qualified institutional buyers. The maturity for the payment of principal is June 13, 2021. Interest on the&#160;Senior Notes accrues at 9% and began accruing on June 14, 2016. Interest is payable on June 15 and December 15 of each year, beginning on December 15, 2016. The&#160;Senior Notes were issued pursuant to an indenture dated as of June&#160;14, 2016 and are guaranteed on a senior unsecured basis by the Company&#8217;s existing and future subsidiaries that incur or guarantee certain indebtedness, including indebtedness under the revolving credit facility. At any time prior to December 14, 2018, the Company may redeem all or a part of the Senior Notes subject to the Make-Whole Price (as defined in the Indenture) and accrued and unpaid interest.&#160; On and after December&#160;14, 2018, the Company may redeem all or a part of the Senior Notes at the redemption price equal to a specified percentage of the principal amount of the redeemed notes (104.50%&#160;for 2018,&#160;102.25%&#160;for 2019, and&#160;100%&#160;for 2020 and thereafter, during the twelve-month period beginning on December 14 of each applicable year), plus accrued and unpaid interest. Additionally, prior to December&#160;14, 2018, the Company can, on one or more occasions, redeem up to 35% of the principal amount of the Senior Notes with all or a portion of the net cash proceeds of one or more Equity Offerings (as defined in the Indenture) at a redemption price equal to 109% of the principal amount of the redeemed notes, plus accrued and unpaid interest, subject to certain conditions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Indenture contains covenants that restrict the Company&#8217;s ability and the ability of certain of its subsidiaries to, among other restrictions and limitations: (i)&#160;incur additional indebtedness; (ii)&#160;incur liens; (iii)&#160;pay dividends; (iv)&#160;consolidate, merge, or transfer all or substantially all of its or their assets; (v)&#160;engage in transactions with affiliates; or (vi)&#160;engage in certain restricted business activities.&#160; These covenants are subject to a number of exceptions and qualifications.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

	&#32;for the years ended August&#160;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The following table summarizes our capital expenditures for oil and gas properties (in thousands):

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	*Capital expenditures reported in the consolidated statement of cash flows are calculated on a cash basis, which differs from the accrual basis used to calculate the capital expenditures.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Excluding the GC Acquisition, the majority of capital expenditures during the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	twelve months ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;were associated with the costs of drilling and completing wells.&#160; During the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	twelve months ended December 31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we drilled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	56
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;operated horizontal wells, completing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	24
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of them.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	, we are the operator of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	49
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	gross (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	44
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	net) horizontal wells in progress, which excludes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	gross (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">
	net) horizontal wells for which we have only set surface casings. All
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the wells in progress at

</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX;PADDING-TOP:0PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
